==== Notes ====
{| class="wikitable"
|-
| (1)
| Works with v4l2 but ''not'' with v4l. But most applications support v4l2 nowadays (ekiga, cheese, skype), so this is almost a non-issue.
|-
| (2)
| Technically this works perfectly with the xrandr tool. The GUI shipped with hardy has many problems however. I could not get it to expand the desktop for instance.
|-
| (3)
| Strangely this key produces the following keysyms in <code>xev</code>: <code>Alt_L (press), KP_Insert, KP_End, KP_Down, KP_Up, Alt_L (release)</code>
|-
| (4)
| There is an issue which seriously affects video performance with 4GB of RAM (see <nowiki>[[https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/210780|210780]]</nowiki>)
|-
| (5)
| Compiz will only work with combined resolutions up to 2048x2048 pixels. This is a driver bug that apparently is <nowiki>[[http://lists.freedesktop.org/archives/xorg/2008-April/034573.html|fixed]]</nowiki> in Xorg trunk!
|-
| (6)
| X will be limited to the maximum supported resolution of the devices connected on startup. If you want to plug in a higher-resolution display after startup or if you want to extend your desktop (aka. multi-head), put in an appropriate <code>Virtual width height</code> line into your <code>/etc/X11/xorg.conf</code> (<nowiki>[[http://www.thinkwiki.org/wiki/Xorg_RandR_1.2#the_Virtual_screen|More detailed explanation]]</nowiki>).
|-
| (7)
| SD cards work, MMC cards can be made to work with a kernel patch, XD and MemoryStick are not supported due to the manufacturer not providing specs AFAICT
|-
| (8)
| The display backlight is switched off automatically by the hardware but HAL does not notice the lid close event.
|-
| (9)
| After resuming from suspend or hibernate, sound is no longer working (see <nowiki>[[https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/200210|200210]]</nowiki>).
|-
| (10)
| The screen blanks but the backlight actually stays on!
|-
| (11)
| You can let the hardware do it via a BIOS setting but I disabled that.
|}

=== Workarounds ===

==== Workaround for "Fails to boot" ====
** To get the LiveCD to boot, pass <code>acpi=off</code> as kernel parameter
** Then install Ubuntu normally
** When booting the installed system you must again pass <code>acpi=off</code>
** Then blacklist the <code>video</code> kernel module:
*** <code>echo "blacklist video" | sudo tee /etc/modprobe.d/blacklist-q45</code>
** Reboot without passing <code>acpi=off</code>

==== Workaround for "MTRRs set up incorrectly with 4GB RAM (slow video)" ====
** A workaround with a useful script is described here: <nowiki>[[https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/210780|210780]]</nowiki>
** '''Please note that you may have to modify it and that not doing that or doing it wrong may well freeze your system and/or render it unbootable! Do this only if you know what you're doing'''

==== Workaround for "Sound does not work after resuming from suspend/hibernate" ====

** Add the option <code>model=hippo</code> to the <code>snd-hda-intel</code> driver:
*** <code>echo "options snd-hda-intel model=hippo" | sudo tee /etc/modprobe.d/sound-q45</code>
** Reboot

==== Workaround for "Card reader cannot read MMC cards" ====
** The kernel patch that has to be applied can be found here: <nowiki>[[http://git.kernel.org/?p=linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux-2.6.git;a=commit;h=882c49164d72c45f37d7fa1bb3de7c31cf1a5fab|RL5c476 MMC support]]</nowiki>.
** You have to recompile the ricoh-mmc module with this patch applied and replace the driver in Ubuntu with the new one.
*** <code>sudo modprobe -r ricoh-mmc</code>
*** <code>sudo apt-get install build-essential linux-headers-`uname -r` wget</code>
*** <code>mkdir ~/ricoh-mmc-fix</code>
*** <code>cd ~/ricoh-mmc-fix</code>
*** <code>wget -O ricoh_mmc.c 'http://git.kernel.org/?p=linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux-2.6.git;a=blob_plain;f=drivers/mmc/host/ricoh_mmc.c;h=a16d7609e4eede4fa88f4ecc6b3ac9dce699038a'</code>
*** <code>echo -ne "obj-m += ricoh_mmc.o\nall:\n\tmake -C /lib/modules/\$(shell uname -r)/build M=\$(PWD) modules\n" > Makefile</code>
*** <code>make</code>
*** <code>sudo mv /lib/modules/`uname -r`/kernel/drivers/mmc/host/ricoh_mmc.ko /lib/modules/`uname -r`/kernel/drivers/mmc/host/ricoh_mmc.ko.hardy</code>
*** <code>sudo cp ricoh_mmc.ko /lib/modules/`uname -r`/kernel/drivers/mmc/host/ricoh_mmc.ko</code>
*** <code>sudo depmod -a</code>
*** <code>sudo modprobe ricoh-mmc</code>
